title: Childhood ice cream mousse cakes
description: These pretty individual cakes taste just like mint choc chip ice cream. Melted white chocolate can be tricky to handle, see the tips section for more info. For this recipe you will need a roll of food-safe acetate, masking tape, a 7cm/2¾in food ring, a 33x22cm/13x8½in Swiss roll tin, an electric whisk, a food processor and a disposable piping bag.
ingredients: 170g/5¾oz baking margarine, plus extra for greasing
233g/8¼oz white chocolate, grated or chopped into very small pieces
180g/6¼oz whipping cream (at room temperature, but not warm as it won't whip)
180g/6¼oz double cream (at room temperature, but not warm as it won't whip)
60g/2¼oz pasteurized egg whites (1½ large free-range egg whites)
large bunch fresh mint, leaves picked
